radiographic_examinations.findings: A reduced thickness of the central retina and the RPEâ€“outer segment complex was demonstrated.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: At age 18, a reduction of the central retinal thickness was documented.

radiographic_examinations.findings: The intensity of the FAF was severely reduced in the entire fundus.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: The FAF did not change after prolonged (17 hours) dark adaptation.

radiographic_examinations.findings: At age 10, no recordable rod response after standard dark adaptation was observed, but a normal combined response and normal cone response were present. At age 18, there was a barely recordable rod response after standard dark adaptation and a significant increase after prolonged dark adaptation.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Normalization of the rod response occurred after prolonged dark adaptation with an increase by more than 700%.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Demonstrated reduced central and peripheral responses.
